page.title: 08SERVICES - OUR POSTMAN
page.content: OUR 999 SERVICES ARE COVERED BY WEST LINTON PUBLIC SCHOOL SURVEY. OUR POSTMAN, IN HIS SPECIAL RED 4-SEATER FORD SIERRA POSTBUS, HAS A SMART UNIFORM AND SPECIAL BADGES. THERE ARE FEW PASSENGERS BUT HE ENJOYS HIS CIRCUIT OF 36 MILES, MAKING ABOUT 163 CALLS. HE WORKS A 43-HOUR WEEK, BEGINNING HIS DAY AT 06.45, FINNISHING HIS RURAL ROUTE AROUND 12.15 AND THEN HE DELIVERS LETTERS AND PARCELS TO PENICUIK POSTOFFICE FROM 4 - 6 PM. OUR POSTMAN ALSO DELIVERS PENSIONS AND MEDICINES TO THE OLD AND HOUSEBOUND. HE MAY BE DELAYED BY HEAVY SNOWFALLS OR BREIFLY BY THE PASSAGE OF ROE DEER, PHEASANT OR A COVEY OF PARTRIDGES. HE MAY STOP TO RESCUE A LAMB CAUGHT IN A FENCE. HE IS ALWAYS KIND AND HELPFUL. HIS PRAYER - "FRAE SNAPPY DUGS AND LETTER BOXES, DEAR LORD, DELIVER US!"
